document.docAuthor: Oliveira, Luiz Fernando M. & Brescovit, Antonio D.
document.masterDocTitle: A taxonomic revision of the Neotropical spider genus Xiruana Brescovit 1997 (Araneae: Anyphaenidae, Anyphaeninae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A taxonomic revision of the Neotropical spider genus Xiruana Brescovit 1997 (Araneae: Anyphaenidae, Anyphaeninae)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Teudis hirsutus
Mello-Leitão, 1938
: 316
, figs 6, 7 (male holotype from Corumbataí
22 ° 13 ’ 12 ”S
;
47 ° 37 ’ 33 ”W
, São Paulo, Brazil ,
20 .XI. 1935
, S. Burian leg., deposited in IBSP 3460 , examined).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis . Males of
X. hirsuta
resembles those of
X. gracilipes
by the conical extremities of the branches of the retrolateral tibial apophysis and by the subtriangular median tibial apophysis, but differ from this species by the male palp with conductor of Anyphaeninae flattened at the tip and with a retrolateral keel, and the short extremities of the branches of the retrolateral tibial apophysis (
Figs 3
A–F). Females differ from congeners by the epigynal plate elongated, with the anterior border with the same width as the posterior border (
Fig. 3
G).

Description . Male ( IBSP 3460 ). Carapace orange, darkest in cephalic region (
Figs 1
A, B). Labium and endites orange. Sternum yellowish. Chelicerae reddish brown. Abdomen grayish. Legs I–IV yellow, darkest at tarsi. Total length 8.1 , carapace length 3.9 , width 3.34 . Clypeus height 0.15 . Eye diameters and interdistances: AME 0.22 , ALE 0.25 , PME 0.21 , PLE 0.21 ; AME–AME 0.06 , AME–ALE 0.05 , PME–PME 0.23 , PME–PLE 0.21 , ALE–PLE 0.05 . Chelicerae 2.25 long, with five promarginal teeth and five retromarginal denticles. Leg measurements: Leg I —femur 4.5 / patella 2.0/ tibia 5.0/ metatarsus 4.65 / tarsus 1.95 / total 18.1 ; II— 4.15 / 1.9 / 4.1 / 3.84 / 1.5 / 15.49 ; III —3.0/ 1.4 / 2.15 / 3.0/ 0.95 / 10.5 ; IV— 4.1 / 1.5 / 3.55 / 5.05 / 1.15 / 15.35 . Leg spination: I—tibia p 1 - 1 -0, metatarsus
v 2
-0-0; II—tibia p 1 - 1 -0, metatarsus
v 2
-0-0; III—tibia p 1 - 1 - 1 , r 1 - 1 - 1 ; IV—tibia p 1 - 1 - 1 , r 1 - 1 - 1 . Palp: Median apophysis straight medially (
Fig. 3
C), median tibial apophysis short and curved (
Figs 3
D–F). Abdomen: length 4.2 , epigastric furrow 0.5 from tracheal spiracle, spiracle 1.9 from base of spinnerets.

Female (MCN 311 ). Coloration as in male (
Figs 1
C, D). Total length 10.5 , carapace length 4.7 , width 3.4 . Clypeus height 0.27 . Eye diameters and interdistances: AME 0.22 , ALE 0.2 , PME 0.2 , PLE 0.22 ; AME–AME 0.12 , AME–ALE 0.08 , PME–PME 0.27 , PME–PLE 0.22 , ALE–PLE 0.12 . Chelicerae 2.25 long, with four promarginal teeth and five retromarginal denticles. Leg measurements: Leg I—femur 4.0/ patella 1.3 / tibia 3.8 / metatarsus 3.45 / tarsus 1.65 / total 14.2 ; II— 3.55 / 1.75 / 3.1 / 2.9 / 1.25 / 12.55 ; III— 2.8 / 1.3 / 2.05 / 2.6 / 0.95 / 9.7 ; IV— 4.05 / 1.65 / 3.2 / 4.55 / 1.05 / 14.5 . Leg spination: I—tibia
v 2 - 2
-0, p0, r0, metatarsus
v 2
-0-0, p0, r0; II—tibia
v 1- 2
-0, p 0-1 -0, r0, metatarsus
v 2
-0-0, p0, r0; III—tibia p 1 - 1 - 1 , r 1 - 1 - 1 ; IV—tibia p 1 - 1 - 1 , r 1 - 1 - 1 . Abdomen: length 6.1 , epigastric furrow 0.62 from tracheal spiracle, spiracle 3.05 from base of spinnerets. Epigynum: seminal receptacles in the middle of the copulatory ducts. Fertilization ducts short arising from lateral sides of spermathecae (
Figs 3
G, H).
Variation . Males (n = 8 ): total length 7.3 –10.0; carapace 3.2–4.65 ; femur I 3.34–4.55 . Females (n = 5 ): total length 10.5–12.2 ; carapace 4.1–4.9 ; femur I 3.55–4.25 .

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 1 .
Xiruana hirsuta (Mello-Leitão)
, habitus: A male, dorsal view; B same, ventral view; C female, dorsal view; D same, ventral view. Abbreviation: TS, tracheal spiracle.
